intro: Cyanea pycnocarpa, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a woody stem with thick, leathery leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cyanea pycnocarpa plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
